page.title: 07LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: (READ HALL) READ HALL WAS BUILT IN THE 16TH CENTURY. IT WAS THE HOME OF THE LOCALLY FAMOUS NOWELL FAMILY.THEIR FAMOUS HISTORY CAN BE TRACED BACK TO THE TIME OF HENRY THE 1ST THE SON OF WILLIAM THE CONQUEROR. ADAM NOWELL (1338)WAS GIVEN A CHARTER TO HOLD A FAIR IN GT. HARWOOD.THE NOWELL FAMILY AT ONE TIME OWNED THE WHOLE OF READ AND THE LOWER TOWN OF GT. HARWOOD.THE NOWELL FAMILY LEFT READ HALL AND ENDED THEIR REIGN AS HOLDERS OF THE MANOR OF READ AND THE LOWER TOWN OF GT. HARWOOD IN 1773.
